security_audit.summary: All 37 static findings are false positives. The scanner incorrectly flagged markdown code block delimiters as shell execution, RGB color values as cryptographic algorithms, and hash characters as C2 keywords. This skill contains only documentation files with no executable code, network calls, or external commands.

content.user_title: Generate Security Assessment Reports in Docx
content.value_statement: Security teams spend hours formatting audit reports manually. This skill automates professional security report generation with risk ratings, CVSS scores, and remediation roadmaps.
actual_capabilities: Generate docx security assessment reports with executive summary and detailed findings
Apply risk rating color coding for Critical, High, Medium, Low, and Info severities
Create findings tables sorted by severity with CVSS scores
Include remediation roadmaps with prioritized timelines
Format professional documents with page breaks and consistent styling
limitations: Does not perform actual vulnerability scanning or security testing
Does not access external systems, APIs, or network resources
Requires python-docx library to be available for file generation
Does not generate charts or data visualizations

use_cases.title: Penetration Test Documentation
use_cases.description: Transform vulnerability findings into formatted penetration test reports with evidence and remediation steps.

use_cases.title: Compliance Gap Analysis
use_cases.description: Create compliance assessment documents with requirement gaps, risk ratings, and remediation timelines.

use_cases.title: Executive Security Briefings
use_cases.description: Generate C-level security summaries with risk overviews and prioritized action plans.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Security Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a security assessment report for these findings: SQL Injection (Critical), XSS (High), Missing headers (Medium). Include executive summary and remediation.

prompt_templates.title: Pentest Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a penetration test report with CVSS scores, evidence sections, and a 90-day remediation roadmap. Use risk rating colors.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Gap Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a PCI DSS compliance gap analysis. Document each requirement, current state, identified gaps, and remediation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Executive Summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an executive security summary for the board. Focus on critical findings, business impact, and prioritized remediation timeline.

output_examples.input: Generate a security report for: SQL Injection in login (Critical), XSS in search (High), Missing CSP headers (Medium).
output: Security Assessment Report generated with 3 findings
Executive Summary: 1 Critical, 1 High, 1 Medium vulnerability identified
Finding 1: SQL Injection - Critical (CVSS 9.8) with remediation steps
Finding 2: Cross-Site Scripting - High (CVSS 8.1) with evidence
Remediation Roadmap: Critical within 7 days, High within 30 days

output_examples.input: Create a compliance gap report for encryption requirements.
output: Gap identified: Data encryption at rest not implemented
Current State: Basic access controls in place
Remediation: Implement AES-256 encryption for sensitive data

output_examples.input: Generate an executive summary for the security audit results.
output: Overall Risk Rating: HIGH - Immediate action required
Critical Findings: 2 items requiring urgent attention
Business Impact: Potential data breach risk quantified
Recommended Investment: 3 engineering weeks for remediation

best_practices: Include CVSS scores and specific evidence for each finding to support prioritization
Use executive summaries for stakeholders and detailed sections for technical teams
Always add remediation timelines based on severity levels
anti_patterns: Do not skip executive summary when reporting to leadership audiences
Do not omit evidence or CVE references from technical findings
Do not use vague severity ratings without CVSS score justification

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It requires computer use capability for docx file generation.

faq.question: What document formats can be generated?
faq.answer: The skill generates docx files using python-docx. PDF export requires additional conversion tools.

faq.question: Can I customize the report template?
faq.answer: Yes. You can modify risk rating colors, section order, and table structures in the skill instructions.

faq.question: Is my security data kept private?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill runs locally with no network calls. All data remains on your machine.

faq.question: Why do table borders not appear correctly?
faq.answer: The python-docx library requires setting borders on each cell individually. The skill includes the correct method.

faq.question: What CVSS version does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill supports CVSS 3.1 scoring. You provide the scores and the skill formats them in the report.
